articles: Giving 10% of your income to the Church will free a child’s soul from Limbo into Heaven, so give your money!
Logical Form: (exists e (forall b ((IsGiven(b,a) and IsInLimbo(c)) and IsInHeaven(e)))) -> (forall a (exists f (IsGiven(f,a))))
Logical Form 2: (exists e (exists a (exists b (exists c ((IsGiven(b,a) and IsInLimbo(c)) and IsInHeaven(e)))))) -> (exists f (exists a (IsGiven(f,a))))

articles: If everyone lived his or her life exactly like Jesus lived his life, the world would be a beautiful place!
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (exists c (IsLivedExactlyLike(a,b) and (IsLivedExactlyLike(a,b) and IsGood(c)))))) -> (exists d (IsBeautiful(d)))

articles: I know you don’t like the kitty-cat sweater that Grandma knitted for you, but she worked so hard on it and it will make her happy to see you wear it in the family holiday photo.
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsKnitted(a) and IsFor(b)))) -> (exists a (exists c (IsWorn(c) and MakesHappy(a))))

articles: Dave wants you to break into the spooky cabin with him. “Everyone does it,” he claims. What fallacy has he committed?
Logical Form 2: (exists b (IsInSpookyCabin(b)) & (forall e (forall d ( ShouldBreakInto(d,e) ->  IsInSpookyCabin(e))))) -> (exists a (exists c (ShouldBreakInto(c,a))))

articles: Ms. Drayer, the smartest person in the universe, says the debate is the best class, therefore it is.
Why did the blond cross the road?  Because she saw a shoe sale!
Logical Form 2: (exists a (exists b (IsBlonde(b) and IsAtShoeSale(a)))) -> (exists a (exists d (IsOnOtherSideOfRoad(d) and IsShoeSale(a))))

articles:
Timmy: Mom, what if I don’t believe in God?
Mom: Then you burn in Hell forever.  Why do you ask?
Timmy: No reason.
Logical Form: (IsBelieveIn(a) and ~IsGod(b) & (forall b (forall d (  IsGod(b) ->   IsForever(d))))) -> (IsBurnIn(a) and IsInHell(c) and IsForever(d))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsBelieveIn(a) and ~IsGod(b))) & (forall f (forall e (  IsGod(e) ->   IsForever(f))))) -> (exists a (exists d (exists c (IsBurnIn(a) and IsInHell(c) and IsForever(d)))))

articles: "If you never gave money to charity, then you must be a greedy millionaire." What is this?
Caroline says that she is going to have lunch with the new girl. Jenna says that she can't believe that Caroline is ditching her old friends for the new girl.
Logical Form: (forall b (exists a (IsGoingToHaveLunch(a,b)))) -> (exists c (exists a (forall b (IsBelieve(c) and (IsDitching(a,b) or IsNewGirl(b))))))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsGoingToHaveLunch(a,b)))) -> (exists b (exists a (exists c (IsBelieve(c) and (IsDitching(a,b) or IsNewGirl(b))))))

articles: "You can never give anyone a break. If you do, they'll walk all over you."
Coach talks with football player, other players and crowd in background. Thus, a football coach talks with his player in front of the team and the crowd.
Logical Form: (exists a (IsTalkWith(a,b)) & (forall b (forall a (forall c ( IsTalkWith(a,b) ->   IsInFrontOfTeam(c)))))) -> (forall c (IsTalkWith(a,b) and IsInFrontOfTeam(c) and IsInCrowd(c)))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsTalkWith(a,b))) & (forall f (forall e (forall d ( IsTalkWith(d,e) ->   IsInFrontOfTeam(f)))))) -> (exists b (exists a (exists c (IsTalkWith(a,b) and IsInFrontOfTeam(c) and IsInCrowd(c)))))

articles: Two men watching one man make a golf putt on the set of Sports Center. As a consequence, people watching sports.
Logical Form: (exists c (IsWatched(a,b) and IsOnSportsCenter(c)) & (forall f (forall e (forall c (  IsOnSportsCenter(c) ->  IsWatched(e,f)))))) -> (forall f (IsWatched(e,f)))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (exists c (IsWatched(a,b) and IsOnSportsCenter(c)))) & (forall g (forall h (forall i (  IsOnSportsCenter(g) ->  IsWatched(h,i)))))) -> (exists f (exists e (IsWatched(e,f))))

articles: Six women wait to use a port-o-john in a field. Thus, women are outside.
Logical Form: (exists b (IsOutside(b)) & (forall a (forall c ( IsOutside(a) ->  IsWaitingToUse(c))))) -> (forall e (IsWaitingToUse(c) and IsInField(e)))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (IsOutside(b)) & (forall g (forall f ( IsOutside(f) ->  IsWaitingToUse(g))))) -> (exists e (exists c (IsWaitingToUse(c) and IsInField(e))))

articles: Women wearing a black top and glasses speaking into a blue tipped microphone with another woman beside her writing. It follows that one woman speaking into a microphone while a second woman writes beside her.
Logical Form: (exists a ((IsWearingBlackTop(c) and IsSpeakingIntoBlueTippedMicrophone(e)) and IsBesideHer(a)) & (forall g (forall e (  IsSpeakingIntoBlueTippedMicrophone(e) ->  IsSpeakingIntoMicrophone(g))))) -> (forall h (forall g (IsSpeakingIntoMicrophone(g) and IsBesideHer(h))))
Logical Form 2: (exists e (exists a (exists c ((IsWearingBlackTop(c) and IsSpeakingIntoBlueTippedMicrophone(e)) and IsBesideHer(a)))) & (forall k (forall j (  IsSpeakingIntoBlueTippedMicrophone(j) ->  IsSpeakingIntoMicrophone(k))))) -> (exists g (exists h (IsSpeakingIntoMicrophone(g) and IsBesideHer(h))))

articles: One tan girl with a wool hat is running and leaning over an object, while another person in a wool hat is sitting on the ground. Therefore, a tan girl runs leans over an object.
Logical Form: (forall b (IsTan(a) and Runs(a) and LeansOver(b))) -> (exists e (IsInWoolHat(d) and SitsOnGround(e)))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsTan(a) and Runs(a) and LeansOver(b)))) -> (exists e (exists d (IsInWoolHat(d) and SitsOnGround(e))))

articles: A scientist studies a slide in order to work on her new creation. It follows that a scientist studies a slide that is related to her invention.
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsStudies(a,b)))) -> (exists b (exists a (exists c (IsRelatedTo(a,c) and IsStudies(a,b)))))

articles: A red dog jumps and catches a tennis ball in its mouth. Consequently, a dog catching a ball.
Logical Form: (IsRed(a) and Jumps(b) and IsCaughtInMouth(c) & (forall e (forall b (  Jumps(b) ->   IsBall(e))))) -> (IsCaught(d) and IsBall(e))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (exists c (IsRed(a) and Jumps(b) and IsCaughtInMouth(c)))) & (forall g (forall f (  Jumps(f) ->   IsBall(g))))) -> (exists e (exists d (IsCaught(d) and IsBall(e))))

articles: A group of dogs stand in the snow. Thus, there are animals outdoors.
Logical Form: (exists a (IsStandingIn(a,b)) & (forall b (forall a (forall c ( IsStandingIn(a,b) ->  IsOutdoors(c)))))) -> (forall c (IsOutdoors(c)))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsStandingIn(a,b))) & (forall f (forall e (forall d ( IsStandingIn(d,e) ->  IsOutdoors(f)))))) -> (exists c (IsOutdoors(c)))

articles: This person looks to be snowboarding on a very small pile of snow on a sunny cold day. This implies that young snowboarder sizing up their next jump.
Logical Form: (forall a (IsSnowboarding(a) and IsOnSmallPileOfSnow(c)) & (forall e (forall a ( IsSnowboarding(a) ->   IsYoungSnowboarder(e)))) & (forall e (forall a (  IsYoungSnowboarder(e) ->  IsSnowboarding(a))))) -> (exists e (IsYou(d) and IsYoungSnowboarder(e) and IsSizingUp(f)))
Logical Form 2: (exists a (exists c (IsSnowboarding(a) and IsOnSmallPileOfSnow(c))) & (forall g (forall h ( IsSnowboarding(g) ->   IsYoungSnowboarder(h)))) & (forall j (forall i (  IsYoungSnowboarder(i) ->  IsSnowboarding(j))))) -> (exists f (exists e (exists d (IsYou(d) and IsYoungSnowboarder(e) and IsSizingUp(f)))))

articles: A large number of people are watching men dressed in kilts, one of whom has thrown a long pole. As a consequence, people watch men in kilts.
Logical Form: (exists b (exists a (IsWatching(a) and AreInKilts(b)))) -> (forall e (forall c (IsWatching(c) and ThrowsLongPole(e))))
Logical Form 2: (exists b (exists a (IsWatching(a) and AreInKilts(b)))) -> (exists e (exists c (IsWatching(c) and ThrowsLongPole(e))))
